entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 6:51AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 2000 Feet today through Thursday... Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected above 200s feet between today and Thursday. This includes the Dalton Highway from Sagwon to Atigun Pass. The snow will develop today and taper off Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 12:05AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GLACIER DAM LAKE RELEASE ONGOING FOR SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER... The Salmon River has been rising since Sunday due to rain and snow melt, but saw a sharper rate of rise on Tuesday of around half a foot every 6 hours, indicating that Summit Lake was draining. The water level on the Salmon River should crest Wednesday or Thursday, however inherent uncertainty in these events result in varying crest

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 10:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SECOND GLACIAL DAM RELEASE ON TAKU RIVER HAS BEGUN... A second glacial dam release has caused rises on the Taku River east of Juneau. We expect river waters to rise over the next twelve hours. Satellite analysis suggests that a crest could occur sometime Wednesday morning, but it is possible that a later crest time could occur depending on how much water is released from Lake Nolake.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
